ygData.subject: RE: Zone times [OT]
ygData.msgSnippet: I think what we re saying here is that there are a large number of factors. I have two machines I play on, both 300Mhz PIIs.  My home one has cable, a kinda
ygData.messageBody:
I think what we're saying here is that there are a large number of factors.
I have two machines I play on, both 300Mhz PIIs. My home one has cable, a
kinda lame IDE HD, and a Voodoo 2. My work one, has a 56k frame relay
shared by the company, a nice fast Baracudda SCSI UW hard disk, and a Riva
128. The work machine zones MUCH slower than my home machine. This would
suggest that network speed, and perhaps video play a part. Perhaps with
non-3dfx cards it has to do some conversion pass on the textures or
something. I think we should all go out and buy top of the line Athlon's
today. :)


At 05:03 PM 10/1/99 -0600, you wrote:
>From: "CYR, Thierry" <tcyr@...>
>
>video cards have alot to do with zoning times, im on a crappy 33.6k
>connection on a 450 with a voodoo 3000 and my friend has a tnt2 on a cable
>with same cpu speeds, he just recently ditched his voodoo2 for the tnt2 and
>he's zoning a lot less fast then before... and another buddie with slower
>machine (p200) is zoning much slower, i can go make a sandwhich before he
>finishes zoning.
>
>Minkin
>Sol ro
>
>> -----Original Message-----
>> From: JasonF [SMTP:JasonF@...]
>> Sent: October 1, 1999 6:42 PM
>> To: eqbards@onelist.com
>> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Zone times [OT]
>>
>> From: "JasonF" <JasonF@...>
>>
>> This is probably going to start another nasty thread, but the zoning times
>> in
>> EQ are enforced long time periods. This is to make zoning intentially
>> tedious
>> so that you don't overuse zoning to escape from monsters. I played on an
>> analog 56k modem connecting at 48000 downstream and 28000 upstream, and
>> when I
>> got 128K upstream, 128K downstream ISDN there was almost no difference in
>> zoning times.
>>
>> Crier Sharpsong - 25th on Fennin Ro
>>
>> Jason A. Farqu´┐¢
>> CDI at http://www.pigging.com/
>>
>>

>> > From: "Daniel P. Sniderman" <fuzzbone@...>
>> >
>> > It's ENTIRELY CPU related. I recently upgraded my X2 connection which
>> > averaged about 41-48K (of course that's upstream only 31K downstream) to
>> > SDSL at 768K (!!!!)
>> >
>> > There is ABSOLUTELY no difference in zoning times in Everquest. So
>> don't
>> > get your hopes up that getting that nifty cable modem, DSL Line (or
>> playing
>> > on that T1 at work when your boss isn't looking) is gonna erase the
>> annoying
>> > zone time.
>> >
>> > There is one difference though... In the analog world I saw that
>> anything
>> > over about 5-7 pct packet loss would create lag. At the ping times I'm
>> > getting now (averages around 125 - occasionally I see two digits pings
>> and
>> > sometimes close to 200) Even packet loss of close to 20 pct doesn't
>> really
>> > cause noticeable lag...
>> >
>> > The biggest advantage of course - when it has to download a patch - the
>> time
>> > download time is basically instantaneous.

>> > Slyde
